SEARCH
Package domain

Class MineSquare

java.lang.Object
domain.Square
domain.MineSquare
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayToken, Serializable
public class MineSquare extends Square
The MineSquare class represents a specialized type of Square that, when activated, removes tokens from the adjacent squares and increases the turn count on the game board. It extends the Square class and overrides the act() method to perform this specific action.
Version:
1.8.5
Author:
Juan Daniel Murcia - Mateo Forero Fuentes

  • Constructor Details

    • MineSquare

      public MineSquare(Board board, int row, int column)
      Constructs a MineSquare with the specified board, row, and column.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board to which the MineSquare belongs.
      row - The row position of the MineSquare on the game board.
      column - The column position of the MineSquare on the game board.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act() throws GomokuException
      Overrides the act() method of the Square class. Detaches the MineSquare from the observer list, sets its token, and removes tokens from the adjacent squares. Finally, increases the turn count on the game board.
      Specified by:
      act in interface PlayToken
      Specified by:
      act in class Square
      Throws:
      GomokuException
